channel.title: Jazz of the past
channel.description:
This series, hosted by Lenny Kessel, presents selections from various rare jazz albums.,For series info, see Item 3397. This prog.: Meade "Lux" Lewis, piano (1940), The Blues; Variations on a Theme, Lewis on harpsichord,For series info, see Item 3397. This prog.: Bugle Call Rag (1932)-Jack Bland, Eddie Connor, Red Allan, Peewee Russell; Mean Old Bed Bug Blues-Peewee Russell, Red allan, others; Spider Crawl; Yellow Dog Blues-Jimmy Lord, Pops Foster; Yes Sir-Rhythm Makers,For series info, see Item 3397. This prog.: Art Tatum (piano), Slam Stuart (bass), and Tiny Grimes (guitar) play Boogy Woogy, Soft Winds, On the Sunny Side of the Street, Topsy, The Man I Love, Get Happy (Mid-1940s),For series info, see Item 3397. This prog.: Mezz Mezzrow, part I. Coming On With the Come On, Revolutionary Blues, I Ain't Going to Give Nobody None of My Jelly Rolls, Gettin' Together, If You See Me Coming, Everybody Loves My Baby,For series info, see Item 3397. This prog.: Mezz Mezzrow, part II. Royal Raredin Blues, Really the Blues, When You and I were Young Maggie, Love You're Not the One for Me, A Melody from the Sky, Blues in Disguise,For series info, see Item 3397. This prog.: Tootin' Through the Roof-Duke Ellington, More Than You Know-Lennie Kesl, Jazz Me Blues-Mezzrow, I Can't Believe You're in Love With Me-Kesl, Yeh Alabamy-Memphis Stompers, Nice Work If You Can Get It-Kesl,For series info, see Item 3397. This prog.: Art Tatum (piano), Slam Stuart (bass), Tiny Grimes (guitar) play Body and Soul, Dark Eyes, If I Had You, I Know That You Know, and Flying Home (1945),For series info, see Item 3397. This prog.: Count Basie, part I: Blue Room (1930), Milin Bird Joys (1932), Honeysuckle Rose (1937), Tom Thumb (1941), Roselyn Shuffle (1937), My Old Flame (1941), Louisiana (early 1940s),For series info, see Item 3397. This prog.: Count Basie, part II: featuring Lester Young, Buck Clayton, Leo Jones, Dicky Wells, and Helen Humes: Hollywood Jump (1939), Easy Does It (1940), Lester Leaps In (late 1940s), Destination Kansas City (late 1940s)

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Pee Wee Russell
item.description: This program focuses on Pee Wee Russell. It features "There'll Be some Changes Made;" "Baby Won't You Please Come Home?;" "Dinah, I Found a New Baby;" "Everybody Loves My Baby;" "Jake Walk;" and "The Last Time I Saw Chicago."
item.dc:creator: Kessel, Lenny
item.dc:subject: U.S. History (1900-present)

item.title: Various artists
item.description: A survey of classic jazz recordings, most of which are original 78 RPM versions. This program features "Then You're Drunk" by Ed Thompson; "I Want to Linger" by Pete Daily; "Heartbeat" by Max Miller; "Give Me a Pig's Foot and a Bottle of Beer" by Bessie Smith; and "Little Benny" by Clyde Hort.
item.dc:creator: Kessel, Lenny
item.dc:subject: Music

item.title: Adrian Rollini
item.description: This program focuses on Adrian Rollini. It includes "Bouncing in Rhythm;" "Lovely Lisa Lee;" "I've Got My Fingers Crossed;" "Stuff Etc.;" "Somebody Loves Me;" "Sugar;" "Davenport Blues;" and "Riverboat Shuffle."
item.dc:creator: Kessel, Lenny
item.dc:subject: U.S. History (1900-present)
